sentence.Network_en: They're resentful that outsiders presume to meddle in their affairs.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们对外人擅自干预他们的事务非常愤慨。

entry.def: If an event or a series of events has been mentioned and you want to talk about it again, you can refer to it as the affair .

example.ex: The government has mishandled the whole affair...
example.tran: 政府对整个事件处理不当。

example.ex: The affair began when customs officials inspected a convoy of 60 tankers...
example.tran: 就在海关关员检查一个60艘油轮的船队时，事情发生了。

entry.tran: …事件（指重要或有趣的事件或情况）
entry.def: You can refer to an important or interesting event or situation as 'the ... affair'.

example.ex: ...the damage caused to the CIA and FBI in the aftermath of the Watergate affair.
example.tran: 水门事件发生后给美国中央情报局和联邦调查局造成的不良影响

example.ex: ...confidential Bank of England documents relating to the BCCI affair.
example.tran: 与国际信贷商业银行事务相关的英格兰银行的机密文件

entry.def: You can describe the main quality of an event by saying that it is a particular kind of affair .

example.ex: Michael said that his planned 10-day visit would be a purely private affair...
example.tran: 迈克尔说他所计划的10天访问纯属个人私事。

example.ex: Breakfast will be a cheerless affair for the Prime Minister this morning.
example.tran: 今天的早餐会让首相感觉全然无味。

entry.tran: （不寻常的或具有某种特点的）东西
entry.def: You can describe an object as a particular kind of affair when you want to draw attention to a particular feature, or indicate that it is unusual.

example.ex: All their beds were distinctive; Mac's was an iron affair with brass knobs...
example.tran: 他们的床都各具特色；马克的床是张带球形黄铜柱头的铁家伙。

example.ex: He tried dividing it into two bundles, tying them to his walking stick, and slinging the whole affair across his back.
example.tran: 他试着将它分成两包绑在他的拐棍上，然后把所有东西都挂在后背上。

entry.def: If two people who are not married to each other have an affair, they have a sexual relationship.

example.ex: She was having an affair with someone at work.

entry.def: You can use affairs to refer to all the important facts or activities that are connected with a particular subject.

example.ex: He does not want to interfere in the internal affairs of another country...
With more details, here's our foreign affairs correspondent.
example.tran: 详细情况，请听我们外交事务记者的报道。

entry.def: Your affairs are all the matters connected with your life which you consider to be private and normally deal with yourself.

example.ex: He was rational and consistent in the conduct of his affairs...
example.tran: 他处理私事时头脑清楚，始终如一。

example.ex: The unexpectedness of my father's death meant that his affairs were not entirely in order.
example.tran: 家父的猝然离世留下了尚未完全安排妥当的身后事。

entry.def: If you say that a decision or situation is someone's affair, you mean that it is their responsibility, and other people should not interfere.

example.ex: If you wish to make a fool of yourself, that is your affair...
example.tran: 如果你想让自己出丑，那是你自己的事。

example.ex: If they want to stay and fight, then I guess that's their affair.
example.tran: 如果他们想留下来打架，我想那是他们自己的事。
